subject: [EXTERNAL] RFQ
body:
Good morning Kendall, 

This is what they sent back to me:

AA59502-2A0084L4 POLYCARBONATE.125 TYPE II CLS 1 WHITE QTY 16 ***HOT***
Need sheet size or unit of measurement 

SF

I guess standard, I am under the assumption that the pn or like something in the PN would tell that info, this is how ive ordered it before

KYDEX 6185 ACRYLIC/PVC QTY 30

IT JUST SAYS EACH lets do sheets…. I have no other info, so lets just do that? 

Hopefully this helps, let me know if you need me to ask anything else. 

Thank you,

>> 
>> ﻿
>> Hi Camille,
>> 
>> I'm doing well, thank you, and I hope you are too!
>> 
>> Could you please confirm whether you are referring to the packing slips and not the automated invoices? There shouldn't be any delay in the packing slip generation feature, as they are typically generated within a minute or two of clicking the button. 
>> 
>> However, there is an intentional delay for invoice batches. I can try to lower it down and see whether we get any errors, as this was the reason for having that dealy on the first place.
>> 
>> I've also identified and am currently fixing an issue with the packing slip feature that prevents it from running, but this is not related to any delays in generation.
>> 
>> Please let me know if you encounter any other issues.
>> 
>> Best,
>> 
>> Shahriar Sakil

subject: APPO25-13657
body:
Hi Nathan, 

I hope you are doing well today! Here are the descriptions for the new part numbers. Let me know if there is anything else I can do to assist! 

PN: 6248853
Desc: This product features USB 3.2 Gen 1 performance for easy access to laptops, desktop PCs, monitors and other digital devices. DT Exodia allows quick transfers and convenient storage of documents, music, videos and more. Its practical design and fashionable colors make it ideal for everyday use at work, home, school or wherever you need to take your data.

USB flash drive
USB 3.2 Gen 1
64 GB
black with teal

PN: MYAP3LL/A 
Desc: The iPhone 16 is a 6.1-inch smartphone with a Super Retina XDR OLED display, A18 chip, dual 48MP/12MP camera system, up to 22 hours video playback, USB-C with MagSafe charging, 5G/Wi-Fi 7 connectivity, IP68 water resistance, Face ID, and enhanced safety features like Emergency SOS via satellite, running iOS 26 with a focus on performance, imaging, and sustainability.
Finish: Black, White, Pink, Teal, Ultramarine.

Build: Aluminum frame, ceramic-shield front, and color-infused glass back.

Storage: Starts at 128 GB.

Dimensions & Weight: 147.6 mm × 71.6 mm × 7.80 mm; ~ 170 g (6.00 oz).

Thank you, 
—
Katie Hilton

UP Aviation
1457 Merrimon Ave.
Asheville, NC 28804

Office: 828.774.5500
Email: katiehilton@upaviation.com

subject: Invoicing Training Guide
body:
Let me know if you want any changes to be made, or anything to be made more clear. This is what I have so far. 

Invoicing Process – Training Guide

Step 1: Ready to Invoice (Monday)

Go to the “Ready to Invoice” table in Monday.

Add invoice quantities for all rows that do not already have a value in the Invoice Qty column.

Partial shipments are handled by Jessi, so you only need to enter quantities for full orders.

This must be completed before 3:00 PM Eastern, when automations run.

Step 2: Review Automation Errors

After 3:00 PM Eastern, automations will run.

Check the accounting@upaviation.com <> inbox for any error notifications.

If an error says an item isn’t in QuickBooks:

Log in to QuickBooks.

Add the missing item(s).

Once added, the item will be picked up automatically and invoiced the next day.

Step 3: Verify Completed Invoices

After automation completes (shortly after 3:00 PM Eastern), an email with all completed invoices will arrive in accounting@upaviation.com <>.

Check each invoice and make sure it is accurate.

Use the PO in Monday to confirm prices, quantities, and customer information are correct.

Step 4: Send Invoices

Once verified, send invoices to the accounts receivable email for the customer.

The majority of invoices go to Gulfstream at accountspayable@gulfstream.com.

We do have other customers besides Gulfstream, so always double-check before sending.

Invoices for other customers must be sent separately to their respective AR emails.

End-of-Process Summary

Fill in blank invoice qtys in Monday (skip partials — Jessi handles those).

Finish before 3:00 PM Eastern.

Fix automation errors via QuickBooks; items will auto-invoice next day.

Check completed invoices for accuracy against the PO in Monday.

Send invoices (usually to Gulfstream AR; other customers handled separately).

—
Katie Hilton

UP Aviation
1457 Merrimon Ave.
Asheville, NC 28804

Office: 828.774.5500
Email: katiehilton@upaviation.com 

￼

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Good evening, Camille & Sakil,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Camille – my apologies for the delay in responding; I was out of the office most of the day. Yes, I’m comfortable checking this for you or making the adjustments on your behalf.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Sakil – I reached out to QuickBooks Online (QBO) support for guidance regarding reordering the custom fields, and here’s the response I received:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Forms (Purchase Orders, Invoices, etc.):
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> QBO does not currently allow direct reordering of custom fields once they’ve been created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The fields typically display in the order they were originally created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> To change the order, you would need to delete the existing fields and recreate them in the desired sequence (e.g., create “PO Number” first, then “Item IDs,” and so on).
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Important note: deleting fields may result in the loss of any data already tied to those fields, so it’s recommended to back up or export data before making changes.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Reports:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When generating reports, you can usually customize the display order by selecting Customize Report and dragging/dropping columns into the preferred sequence.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> This applies only to the report view, not the forms themselves.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In short, QBO does not support drag-and-drop reordering of custom fields within forms or system-generated lists like purchase orders. The only workaround is to delete and recreate fields in the order you’d like as you previously suspected.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Please let me know if you’d like me to take any action in QBO on your behalf, or if it makes sense for us to schedule a quick call, as you suggested earlier, Camille.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Kind regards,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Right now, you have five custom fields in total:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> PO No.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> VENDOR CODE
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Vendor Details
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> PO Number
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Item IDs
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> They are ordered by creation date. Since QuickBooks only allows API access to the first three custom fields, we currently can’t access PO Number and Item IDs - but those are the ones we need for the auto-invoicing system to work correctly.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The solution is to reorder the fields so they look like this:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> PO Number
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Item IDs
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> PO No.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> VENDOR CODE
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Vendor Details
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> I’m not sure if QuickBooks allows this kind of reordering directly, but I’m confident their support team can help. Could you please contact QuickBooks support and request that they reorder the fields as above?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> If they can’t or won’t, then the alternative would be to delete all of the existing custom fields and recreate them in the correct order. That said, an important question is what happens to existing documents (like invoices) that currently use those fields - QuickBooks support should be able to clarify this for you.

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Hi Camille and Katie,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> I've prepared a Loom recording of the automatic invoicing system to gather your feedback. You can view it here <https://www.loom.com/share/938098ed598f498c99e53eb8de9ed059?sid=2f2cdc01-b5bb-45ab-acf2-d3f09c8b01e4>.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Here's a quick overview:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In addition to changing a line item's status to "ready to invoice", you'll now need to specify whether you want it as a single invoice or part of a group invoice.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> For partial invoicing, I've added a new column where you can enter the quantity you wish to invoice. While I can implement logic to ignore this for non-partial invoices, I highly recommend using this column for all invoices to prevent errors.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The automation will run for a defined number of times a day, sweep all of the line items ready to be invoiced, and generate invoices based on the grouping status (single/group) and the invoice quantity. 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Once we've finalized this, I'll move on to packing slips. I have a few questions regarding them:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When would you prefer the packing slips to be auto-generated?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Does one invoice typically correspond to one shipment, and therefore one packing slip?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Your feedback on these points would be greatly appreciated.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Thanks,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Sakil – I reached out to QuickBooks Online (QBO) support for guidance regarding reordering the custom fields, and here’s the response I received:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Forms (Purchase Orders, Invoices, etc.):
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> QBO does not currently allow direct reordering of custom fields once they’ve been created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The fields typically display in the order they were originally created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> To change the order, you would need to delete the existing fields and recreate them in the desired sequence (e.g., create “PO Number” first, then “Item IDs,” and so on).
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Important note: deleting fields may result in the loss of any data already tied to those fields, so it’s recommended to back up or export data before making changes.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Reports:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When generating reports, you can usually customize the display order by selecting Customize Report and dragging/dropping columns into the preferred sequence.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> This applies only to the report view, not the forms themselves.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In short, QBO does not support drag-and-drop reordering of custom fields within forms or system-generated lists like purchase orders. The only workaround is to delete and recreate fields in the order you’d like as you previously suspected.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Please let me know if you’d like me to take any action in QBO on your behalf, or if it makes sense for us to schedule a quick call, as you suggested earlier, Camille.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Kind regards,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Hi Camille and Katie,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> I've prepared a Loom recording of the automatic invoicing system to gather your feedback. You can view it here <https://www.loom.com/share/938098ed598f498c99e53eb8de9ed059?sid=2f2cdc01-b5bb-45ab-acf2-d3f09c8b01e4>.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Here's a quick overview:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In addition to changing a line item's status to "ready to invoice", you'll now need to specify whether you want it as a single invoice or part of a group invoice.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> For partial invoicing, I've added a new column where you can enter the quantity you wish to invoice. While I can implement logic to ignore this for non-partial invoices, I highly recommend using this column for all invoices to prevent errors.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The automation will run for a defined number of times a day, sweep all of the line items ready to be invoiced, and generate invoices based on the grouping status (single/group) and the invoice quantity. 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Once we've finalized this, I'll move on to packing slips. I have a few questions regarding them:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When would you prefer the packing slips to be auto-generated?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Does one invoice typically correspond to one shipment, and therefore one packing slip?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Your feedback on these points would be greatly appreciated.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Thanks,

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> ﻿
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Good evening, Camille & Sakil,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Camille – my apologies for the delay in responding; I was out of the office most of the day. Yes, I’m comfortable checking this for you or making the adjustments on your behalf.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Sakil – I reached out to QuickBooks Online (QBO) support for guidance regarding reordering the custom fields, and here’s the response I received:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Forms (Purchase Orders, Invoices, etc.):
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> QBO does not currently allow direct reordering of custom fields once they’ve been created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The fields typically display in the order they were originally created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> To change the order, you would need to delete the existing fields and recreate them in the desired sequence (e.g., create “PO Number” first, then “Item IDs,” and so on).
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Important note: deleting fields may result in the loss of any data already tied to those fields, so it’s recommended to back up or export data before making changes.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Reports:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When generating reports, you can usually customize the display order by selecting Customize Report and dragging/dropping columns into the preferred sequence.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> This applies only to the report view, not the forms themselves.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In short, QBO does not support drag-and-drop reordering of custom fields within forms or system-generated lists like purchase orders. The only workaround is to delete and recreate fields in the order you’d like as you previously suspected.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Please let me know if you’d like me to take any action in QBO on your behalf, or if it makes sense for us to schedule a quick call, as you suggested earlier, Camille.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Kind regards,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Hi Camille and Katie,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> I've prepared a Loom recording of the automatic invoicing system to gather your feedback. You can view it here <https://www.loom.com/share/938098ed598f498c99e53eb8de9ed059?sid=2f2cdc01-b5bb-45ab-acf2-d3f09c8b01e4>.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Here's a quick overview:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In addition to changing a line item's status to "ready to invoice", you'll now need to specify whether you want it as a single invoice or part of a group invoice.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> For partial invoicing, I've added a new column where you can enter the quantity you wish to invoice. While I can implement logic to ignore this for non-partial invoices, I highly recommend using this column for all invoices to prevent errors.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The automation will run for a defined number of times a day, sweep all of the line items ready to be invoiced, and generate invoices based on the grouping status (single/group) and the invoice quantity. 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Once we've finalized this, I'll move on to packing slips. I have a few questions regarding them:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When would you prefer the packing slips to be auto-generated?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Does one invoice typically correspond to one shipment, and therefore one packing slip?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Your feedback on these points would be greatly appreciated.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Thanks,

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> ﻿
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Good evening, Camille & Sakil,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Camille – my apologies for the delay in responding; I was out of the office most of the day. Yes, I’m comfortable checking this for you or making the adjustments on your behalf.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Sakil – I reached out to QuickBooks Online (QBO) support for guidance regarding reordering the custom fields, and here’s the response I received:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Forms (Purchase Orders, Invoices, etc.):
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> QBO does not currently allow direct reordering of custom fields once they’ve been created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The fields typically display in the order they were originally created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> To change the order, you would need to delete the existing fields and recreate them in the desired sequence (e.g., create “PO Number” first, then “Item IDs,” and so on).
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Important note: deleting fields may result in the loss of any data already tied to those fields, so it’s recommended to back up or export data before making changes.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Reports:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When generating reports, you can usually customize the display order by selecting Customize Report and dragging/dropping columns into the preferred sequence.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> This applies only to the report view, not the forms themselves.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In short, QBO does not support drag-and-drop reordering of custom fields within forms or system-generated lists like purchase orders. The only workaround is to delete and recreate fields in the order you’d like as you previously suspected.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Please let me know if you’d like me to take any action in QBO on your behalf, or if it makes sense for us to schedule a quick call, as you suggested earlier, Camille.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Kind regards,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Hi Camille and Katie,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> I've prepared a Loom recording of the automatic invoicing system to gather your feedback. You can view it here <https://www.loom.com/share/938098ed598f498c99e53eb8de9ed059?sid=2f2cdc01-b5bb-45ab-acf2-d3f09c8b01e4>.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Here's a quick overview:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In addition to changing a line item's status to "ready to invoice", you'll now need to specify whether you want it as a single invoice or part of a group invoice.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> For partial invoicing, I've added a new column where you can enter the quantity you wish to invoice. While I can implement logic to ignore this for non-partial invoices, I highly recommend using this column for all invoices to prevent errors.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The automation will run for a defined number of times a day, sweep all of the line items ready to be invoiced, and generate invoices based on the grouping status (single/group) and the invoice quantity. 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Once we've finalized this, I'll move on to packing slips. I have a few questions regarding them:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When would you prefer the packing slips to be auto-generated?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Does one invoice typically correspond to one shipment, and therefore one packing slip?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Your feedback on these points would be greatly appreciated.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Thanks,

subject: 2nd Phase Integrations: Invoicing
body:
Good morning Sakil, 

When you get a chance, can you please adjust the time back for automated invoices to 3:00pm EST? 

Thank you, 
—
Katie Hilton
UP Aviation

1457 Merrimon Ave.
Asheville, NC 28804

Email: katiehilton@upaviation.com

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Good evening, Camille & Sakil,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Camille – my apologies for the delay in responding; I was out of the office most of the day. Yes, I’m comfortable checking this for you or making the adjustments on your behalf.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Sakil – I reached out to QuickBooks Online (QBO) support for guidance regarding reordering the custom fields, and here’s the response I received:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Forms (Purchase Orders, Invoices, etc.):
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> QBO does not currently allow direct reordering of custom fields once they’ve been created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The fields typically display in the order they were originally created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> To change the order, you would need to delete the existing fields and recreate them in the desired sequence (e.g., create “PO Number” first, then “Item IDs,” and so on).
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Important note: deleting fields may result in the loss of any data already tied to those fields, so it’s recommended to back up or export data before making changes.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Reports:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When generating reports, you can usually customize the display order by selecting Customize Report and dragging/dropping columns into the preferred sequence.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> This applies only to the report view, not the forms themselves.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In short, QBO does not support drag-and-drop reordering of custom fields within forms or system-generated lists like purchase orders. The only workaround is to delete and recreate fields in the order you’d like as you previously suspected.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Please let me know if you’d like me to take any action in QBO on your behalf, or if it makes sense for us to schedule a quick call, as you suggested earlier, Camille.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Kind regards,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Hi Camille and Katie,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> I've prepared a Loom recording of the automatic invoicing system to gather your feedback. You can view it here <https://www.loom.com/share/938098ed598f498c99e53eb8de9ed059?sid=2f2cdc01-b5bb-45ab-acf2-d3f09c8b01e4>.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Here's a quick overview:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In addition to changing a line item's status to "ready to invoice", you'll now need to specify whether you want it as a single invoice or part of a group invoice.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> For partial invoicing, I've added a new column where you can enter the quantity you wish to invoice. While I can implement logic to ignore this for non-partial invoices, I highly recommend using this column for all invoices to prevent errors.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The automation will run for a defined number of times a day, sweep all of the line items ready to be invoiced, and generate invoices based on the grouping status (single/group) and the invoice quantity. 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Once we've finalized this, I'll move on to packing slips. I have a few questions regarding them:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When would you prefer the packing slips to be auto-generated?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Does one invoice typically correspond to one shipment, and therefore one packing slip?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Your feedback on these points would be greatly appreciated.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Thanks,

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> function doPost(e) {
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>  try {
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Parse JSON body
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const params = e.postData.contents ? JSON.parse(e.postData.contents) : {};
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Defaults if not provided
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const customFilename = params.filename || "packing-slip.pdf";
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Spreadsheet & folder
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const spreadsheetId = "1IBRyMsA3y1nHBguZOrjfiJxs4CvlcX_sG-YvUFxUjQg";
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const sheetName = "Packing Slip";
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const folderId = "1asOmvSaOONyNm-wXZY5WzhlYz2bmU3TX";
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const folder = DriveApp.getFolderById(folderId);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Export the sheet
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const sheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet().getSheetByName(sheetName);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const url = "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/" + spreadsheetId +
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      "/export?format=pdf&portrait=true&size=A4&sheetnames=false&printtitle=false" +
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      "&pagenumbers=false&gridlines=false&fzr=false&gid=" + sheet.getSheetId();
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const token = ScriptApp.getOAuthToken();
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const response = UrlFetchApp.fetch(url, {
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      headers: { Authorization: "Bearer " + token }
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    });
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Save with custom filename
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const blob = response.getBlob().setName(customFilename);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const file = folder.createFile(blob);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Make it shareable
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    file.setSharing(DriveApp.Access.ANYONE_WITH_LINK, DriveApp.Permission.VIEW);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Return JSON
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    return ContentService.createTextOutput(
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      JSON.stringify({
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>        filename: file.getName(),
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>        url: file.getUrl(),
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>        id: file.getId(),
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      })
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    ).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>  } catch (err) {
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    return ContentService.createTextOutput(
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      JSON.stringify({ error: err.toString() })
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    ).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>  }
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> }
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

subject: 2nd Phase Integrations: Packing Slips
body:
Hi Sakil, 

I have noticed recently that a lot of PO’s are being created in CRM for files that we have set up to be automated now. It consists of invoices and packing slips mostly, but also some compliance forms we receive. Is there any way to fix this?

Thank you, 
—
Katie Hilton
UP Aviation

1457 Merrimon Ave.
Asheville, NC 28804

Office: 828.774.5500
Email: katiehilton@upaviation.com 
_____________________________________________

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      "/export?format=pdf&portrait=true&size=A4&sheetnames=false&printtitle=false" +

>>>>>>>>>>>> function doPost(e) {
>>>>>>>>>>>>  try {

>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>>>    const spreadsheetId = params.spreadsheetId;
>>>>>>>>>>>>    const sheetName = "Packing Slip";
>>>>>>>>>>>>    const folderId = "1asOmvSaOONyNm-wXZY5WzhlYz2bmU3TX";

>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>>>    const url = "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/" + spreadsheetId +
>>>>>>>>>>>>      "/export?format=pdf&portrait=true&size=A4&sheetnames=false&printtitle=false" +
>>>>>>>>>>>>      "&pagenumbers=false&gridlines=false&fzr=false&gid=" + sheet.getSheetId();
>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>>>    const response = UrlFetchApp.fetch(url, {

>>>>>>>>>>>>        id: file.getId(),
>>>>>>>>>>>>      })
>>>>>>>>>>>>    ).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);

>>>>>>>>>>>>    return ContentService.createTextOutput(
>>>>>>>>>>>>      JSON.stringify({ error: err.toString() })
>>>>>>>>>>>>    ).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
>>>>>>>>>>>>  }
>>>>>>>>>>>> }

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> function doPost(e) {
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>  try {
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Parse JSON body
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const params = e.postData.contents ? JSON.parse(e.postData.contents) : {};
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Defaults if not provided
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const customFilename = params.filename || "packing-slip.pdf";
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Spreadsheet & folder
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const spreadsheetId = "1IBRyMsA3y1nHBguZOrjfiJxs4CvlcX_sG-YvUFxUjQg";
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const sheetName = "Packing Slip";
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const folderId = "1asOmvSaOONyNm-wXZY5WzhlYz2bmU3TX";
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const folder = DriveApp.getFolderById(folderId);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Export the sheet
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const sheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet().getSheetByName(sheetName);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const url = "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/" + spreadsheetId +
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      "/export?format=pdf&portrait=true&size=A4&sheetnames=false&printtitle=false" +
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      "&pagenumbers=false&gridlines=false&fzr=false&gid=" + sheet.getSheetId();
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const token = ScriptApp.getOAuthToken();
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const response = UrlFetchApp.fetch(url, {
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      headers: { Authorization: "Bearer " + token }
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    });
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Save with custom filename
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const blob = response.getBlob().setName(customFilename);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const file = folder.createFile(blob);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Make it shareable
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    file.setSharing(DriveApp.Access.ANYONE_WITH_LINK, DriveApp.Permission.VIEW);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Return JSON
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    return ContentService.createTextOutput(
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      JSON.stringify({
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>        filename: file.getName(),
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>        url: file.getUrl(),
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>        id: file.getId(),
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      })
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    ).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>  } catch (err) {
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    return ContentService.createTextOutput(
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      JSON.stringify({ error: err.toString() })
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    ).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>  }
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> }
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> —
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Katie Hilton

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const folder = DriveApp.getFolderById(folderId);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Export the sheet
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const sheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet().getSheetByName(sheetName);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const url = "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/" + spreadsheetId +
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      "/export?format=pdf&portrait=true&size=A4&sheetnames=false&printtitle=false" +
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      "&pagenumbers=false&gridlines=false&fzr=false&gid=" + sheet.getSheetId();
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const token = ScriptApp.getOAuthToken();
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const response = UrlFetchApp.fetch(url, {
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      headers: { Authorization: "Bearer " + token }
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    });
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Save with custom filename
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const blob = response.getBlob().setName(customFilename);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const file = folder.createFile(blob);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Make it shareable
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    file.setSharing(DriveApp.Access.ANYONE_WITH_LINK, DriveApp.Permission.VIEW);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Return JSON
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    return ContentService.createTextOutput(
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      JSON.stringify({
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>        filename: file.getName(),
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>        url: file.getUrl(),
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>        id: file.getId(),
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      })
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    ).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>  } catch (err) {
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    return ContentService.createTextOutput(
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      JSON.stringify({ error: err.toString() })
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    ).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>  }
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> }
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> —
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Katie Hilton
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> UP Aviation

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> function doPost(e) {
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>  try {
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Parse JSON body
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const params = e.postData.contents ? JSON.parse(e.postData.contents) : {};
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Defaults if not provided
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const customFilename = params.filename || "packing-slip.pdf";
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Spreadsheet & folder
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const spreadsheetId = "1IBRyMsA3y1nHBguZOrjfiJxs4CvlcX_sG-YvUFxUjQg";
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const sheetName = "Packing Slip";
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const folderId = "1asOmvSaOONyNm-wXZY5WzhlYz2bmU3TX";
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const folder = DriveApp.getFolderById(folderId);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Export the sheet
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const sheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet().getSheetByName(sheetName);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const url = "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/" + spreadsheetId +
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      "/export?format=pdf&portrait=true&size=A4&sheetnames=false&printtitle=false" +
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      "&pagenumbers=false&gridlines=false&fzr=false&gid=" + sheet.getSheetId();
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const token = ScriptApp.getOAuthToken();
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const response = UrlFetchApp.fetch(url, {
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      headers: { Authorization: "Bearer " + token }
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    });
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Save with custom filename
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const blob = response.getBlob().setName(customFilename);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    const file = folder.createFile(blob);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Make it shareable
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    file.setSharing(DriveApp.Access.ANYONE_WITH_LINK, DriveApp.Permission.VIEW);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    // Return JSON
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    return ContentService.createTextOutput(
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      JSON.stringify({
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>        filename: file.getName(),
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>        url: file.getUrl(),
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>        id: file.getId(),
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      })
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    ).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>  } catch (err) {
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    return ContentService.createTextOutput(
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>      JSON.stringify({ error: err.toString() })
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>    ).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>  }
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> }
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

subject: 2nd Phase Integrations: Packing Slips
body:
Hi Sakil, 

I’m having the same issue as last time, no matter how many times I try the URL doesn’t work. Does this look correct to you? 

function doPost(e) {
 try {
   // Parse JSON body
   const params = e.postData.contents ? JSON.parse(e.postData.contents) : {};

   // Defaults if not provided
   const customFilename = params.filename || "packing-slip.pdf";

   // Spreadsheet & folder
   const spreadsheetId = params.spreadsheetId;
   const sheetName = "Packing Slip";
   const folderId = "1asOmvSaOONyNm-wXZY5WzhlYz2bmU3TX";
   const folder = DriveApp.getFolderById(folderId);

   // Export the sheet
   const sheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet().getSheetByName(sheetName);
   const url = "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/" + spreadsheetId +
     "/export?format=pdf&portrait=true&size=A4&sheetnames=false&printtitle=false" +
     "&pagenumbers=false&gridlines=false&fzr=false&gid=" + sheet.getSheetId();

   const token = ScriptApp.getOAuthToken();
   const response = UrlFetchApp.fetch(url, {
     headers: { Authorization: "Bearer " + token }
   });

   // Save with custom filename
   const blob = response.getBlob().setName(customFilename);
   const file = folder.createFile(blob);

   // Make it shareable
   file.setSharing(DriveApp.Access.ANYONE_WITH_LINK, DriveApp.Permission.VIEW);

   // Return JSON
   return ContentService.createTextOutput(
     JSON.stringify({
       filename: file.getName(),
       url: file.getUrl(),
       id: file.getId(),
     })
   ).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);

 } catch (err) {
   return ContentService.createTextOutput(
     JSON.stringify({ error: err.toString() })
   ).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
 }
}
—
Katie Hilton
UP Aviation

1457 Merrimon Ave.
Asheville, NC 28804

Office: 828.774.5500
Email: katiehilton@upaviation.com 
_____________________________________________

subject: 2nd Phase Integrations: Packing Slips
body:
Hi Sakil, 

I made some adjustments to the packing slip template. Everything on there now can be permanent. Everything else needed can come from the purchase order itself. I will also attach a completed version that would come from the purchase order APPO25-12240. The only thing we anticipate to have to do manual entry for is MFG P column, and possibly if we add more notes to the description that are not noted on the PO. 

I will attach the purchase order for APPO25-12240 as well, if you would like to use it as a reference. If this is confusing at all, I am happy to setup a meeting with you to explain it further. I am available anytime today until around 3pm EST, but can meet later if needed. 

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IBRyMsA3y1nHBguZOrjfiJxs4CvlcX_sG-YvUFxUjQg/edit?usp=sharing￼
packing slip template
docs.google.com
￼

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/16a4AIYZfucXkbvuVgyR7O4m3wq89fXbCca59O0t3ZQg/edit?usp=sharing￼
Copy of packing slip template
docs.google.com

Thank you, 
—
Katie Hilton
UP Aviation

1457 Merrimon Ave.
Asheville, NC 28804

Office: 828.774.5500
Email: katiehilton@upaviation.com 
_____________________________________________

>>

body:
Hi Kyle,

The screen protector you were looking at is only made for the iPhone 15, but I have pulled together a quote for the newest version that’s designed for the iPhone 16.

Here are the details:

PN: 77-96187

Price: $71.41 each

Made for: iPhone 16 Pro

Drop Protection: Survives drops up to 3ft (Drop+)

Size: 5.72 in x 2.64 in x 0.03 in

Weight: 0.03 lbs

Material: Aluminosilicate glass

This updated model gives you the same durability and clarity, just tailored for the iPhone 16.

Let me know if this is something you would be interested in, as I can get it on order asap! 

Thank you, 

—
Katie Hilton

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Camille – my apologies for the delay in responding; I was out of the office most of the day. Yes, I’m comfortable checking this for you or making the adjustments on your behalf.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Sakil – I reached out to QuickBooks Online (QBO) support for guidance regarding reordering the custom fields, and here’s the response I received:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Forms (Purchase Orders, Invoices, etc.):
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> QBO does not currently allow direct reordering of custom fields once they’ve been created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The fields typically display in the order they were originally created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> To change the order, you would need to delete the existing fields and recreate them in the desired sequence (e.g., create “PO Number” first, then “Item IDs,” and so on).
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Important note: deleting fields may result in the loss of any data already tied to those fields, so it’s recommended to back up or export data before making changes.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Reports:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When generating reports, you can usually customize the display order by selecting Customize Report and dragging/dropping columns into the preferred sequence.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> This applies only to the report view, not the forms themselves.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In short, QBO does not support drag-and-drop reordering of custom fields within forms or system-generated lists like purchase orders. The only workaround is to delete and recreate fields in the order you’d like as you previously suspected.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Please let me know if you’d like me to take any action in QBO on your behalf, or if it makes sense for us to schedule a quick call, as you suggested earlier, Camille.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Kind regards,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> On Aug 28, 2025, at 8:00 AM, Shahriar Sakil <sakil@crmcrew.com <mailto:sakil@crmcrew.com>> wrote:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Hi Camille and Katie,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> I've prepared a Loom recording of the automatic invoicing system to gather your feedback. You can view it here <https://www.loom.com/share/938098ed598f498c99e53eb8de9ed059?sid=2f2cdc01-b5bb-45ab-acf2-d3f09c8b01e4>.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Here's a quick overview:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In addition to changing a line item's status to "ready to invoice", you'll now need to specify whether you want it as a single invoice or part of a group invoice.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> For partial invoicing, I've added a new column where you can enter the quantity you wish to invoice. While I can implement logic to ignore this for non-partial invoices, I highly recommend using this column for all invoices to prevent errors.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The automation will run for a defined number of times a day, sweep all of the line items ready to be invoiced, and generate invoices based on the grouping status (single/group) and the invoice quantity. 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> ﻿
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Good evening, Camille & Sakil,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Camille – my apologies for the delay in responding; I was out of the office most of the day. Yes, I’m comfortable checking this for you or making the adjustments on your behalf.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Sakil – I reached out to QuickBooks Online (QBO) support for guidance regarding reordering the custom fields, and here’s the response I received:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Forms (Purchase Orders, Invoices, etc.):
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> QBO does not currently allow direct reordering of custom fields once they’ve been created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The fields typically display in the order they were originally created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> To change the order, you would need to delete the existing fields and recreate them in the desired sequence (e.g., create “PO Number” first, then “Item IDs,” and so on).
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Important note: deleting fields may result in the loss of any data already tied to those fields, so it’s recommended to back up or export data before making changes.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Reports:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When generating reports, you can usually customize the display order by selecting Customize Report and dragging/dropping columns into the preferred sequence.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> This applies only to the report view, not the forms themselves.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In short, QBO does not support drag-and-drop reordering of custom fields within forms or system-generated lists like purchase orders. The only workaround is to delete and recreate fields in the order you’d like as you previously suspected.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Please let me know if you’d like me to take any action in QBO on your behalf, or if it makes sense for us to schedule a quick call, as you suggested earlier, Camille.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Kind regards,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Hey Camille,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> I know this situation is confusing, and I really appreciate all your help in working through it.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Right now, you have five custom fields in total:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> PO No.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> VENDOR CODE
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Vendor Details
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> PO Number
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Item IDs
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> They are ordered by creation date. Since QuickBooks only allows API access to the first three custom fields, we currently can’t access PO Number and Item IDs - but those are the ones we need for the auto-invoicing system to work correctly.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The solution is to reorder the fields so they look like this:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> PO Number
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Item IDs
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> PO No.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> VENDOR CODE
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Vendor Details
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> I’m not sure if QuickBooks allows this kind of reordering directly, but I’m confident their support team can help. Could you please contact QuickBooks support and request that they reorder the fields as above?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> If they can’t or won’t, then the alternative would be to delete all of the existing custom fields and recreate them in the correct order. That said, an important question is what happens to existing documents (like invoices) that currently use those fields - QuickBooks support should be able to clarify this for you.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Could you please reach out to them and check on this? Let me know if you have any queries.

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> I've prepared a Loom recording of the automatic invoicing system to gather your feedback. You can view it here <https://www.loom.com/share/938098ed598f498c99e53eb8de9ed059?sid=2f2cdc01-b5bb-45ab-acf2-d3f09c8b01e4>.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Here's a quick overview:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In addition to changing a line item's status to "ready to invoice", you'll now need to specify whether you want it as a single invoice or part of a group invoice.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> For partial invoicing, I've added a new column where you can enter the quantity you wish to invoice. While I can implement logic to ignore this for non-partial invoices, I highly recommend using this column for all invoices to prevent errors.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The automation will run for a defined number of times a day, sweep all of the line items ready to be invoiced, and generate invoices based on the grouping status (single/group) and the invoice quantity. 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Once we've finalized this, I'll move on to packing slips. I have a few questions regarding them:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When would you prefer the packing slips to be auto-generated?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Does one invoice typically correspond to one shipment, and therefore one packing slip?

subject: 2nd Phase Integrations: Invoicing
body:
Hi Sakil, 

I noticed that each PO that has been invoiced by the new system seems to be creating a duplicate PO in CRM after the fact (some even have multiple duplicates). Do you want to take a look at them, or should I just delete the duplicates?

Let me know how I can help! 

Thank you, 
—
Katie Hilton
UP Aviation

1457 Merrimon Ave.
Asheville, NC 28804

Office: 828.774.5500
Email: katiehilton@upaviation.com 
_____________________________________________

>> On Sep 9, 2025, at 9:36 AM, Shahriar Sakil <sakil@crmcrew.com> wrote:
>> 
>> Hi Katie, 
>> 
>> There are some changes and additional configurations needed on the invoice template that I cannot do from my end. You can find the instructions on this loom video here <https://www.loom.com/share/1993da8fc1464e4aae36d7eb8baca44b?sid=80e73ae9-1d23-4b59-8fd2-f983c6d595b7>. The code mentioned in the video can be found in the document here <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1_ks4ZBmVu7CAdYucpeq2DnGUq4K5Vc4_AXUjd5y-_kk/edit?usp=sharing>.
>> 
>> One thing I forgot to mention is that you should hide the first row i.e., the header row. And after you're done with all of those changes, generate an actual packing slip for a customer and send it over for me to do the mapping. 
>> 
>> Appreciate all the help! 
>> 
>> Shahriar Sakil 
>> Technical Lead
>>  
>> CRMCrew

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Good evening, Camille & Sakil,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Camille – my apologies for the delay in responding; I was out of the office most of the day. Yes, I’m comfortable checking this for you or making the adjustments on your behalf.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Sakil – I reached out to QuickBooks Online (QBO) support for guidance regarding reordering the custom fields, and here’s the response I received:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Forms (Purchase Orders, Invoices, etc.):
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> QBO does not currently allow direct reordering of custom fields once they’ve been created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The fields typically display in the order they were originally created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> To change the order, you would need to delete the existing fields and recreate them in the desired sequence (e.g., create “PO Number” first, then “Item IDs,” and so on).
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Important note: deleting fields may result in the loss of any data already tied to those fields, so it’s recommended to back up or export data before making changes.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Reports:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When generating reports, you can usually customize the display order by selecting Customize Report and dragging/dropping columns into the preferred sequence.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> This applies only to the report view, not the forms themselves.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In short, QBO does not support drag-and-drop reordering of custom fields within forms or system-generated lists like purchase orders. The only workaround is to delete and recreate fields in the order you’d like as you previously suspected.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Please let me know if you’d like me to take any action in QBO on your behalf, or if it makes sense for us to schedule a quick call, as you suggested earlier, Camille.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Kind regards,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Hi Camille and Katie,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> I've prepared a Loom recording of the automatic invoicing system to gather your feedback. You can view it here <https://www.loom.com/share/938098ed598f498c99e53eb8de9ed059?sid=2f2cdc01-b5bb-45ab-acf2-d3f09c8b01e4>.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Here's a quick overview:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In addition to changing a line item's status to "ready to invoice", you'll now need to specify whether you want it as a single invoice or part of a group invoice.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> For partial invoicing, I've added a new column where you can enter the quantity you wish to invoice. While I can implement logic to ignore this for non-partial invoices, I highly recommend using this column for all invoices to prevent errors.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The automation will run for a defined number of times a day, sweep all of the line items ready to be invoiced, and generate invoices based on the grouping status (single/group) and the invoice quantity. 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Once we've finalized this, I'll move on to packing slips. I have a few questions regarding them:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When would you prefer the packing slips to be auto-generated?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Does one invoice typically correspond to one shipment, and therefore one packing slip?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Your feedback on these points would be greatly appreciated.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Thanks,

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Camille – my apologies for the delay in responding; I was out of the office most of the day. Yes, I’m comfortable checking this for you or making the adjustments on your behalf.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Sakil – I reached out to QuickBooks Online (QBO) support for guidance regarding reordering the custom fields, and here’s the response I received:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Forms (Purchase Orders, Invoices, etc.):
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> QBO does not currently allow direct reordering of custom fields once they’ve been created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The fields typically display in the order they were originally created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> To change the order, you would need to delete the existing fields and recreate them in the desired sequence (e.g., create “PO Number” first, then “Item IDs,” and so on).
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Important note: deleting fields may result in the loss of any data already tied to those fields, so it’s recommended to back up or export data before making changes.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Reports:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When generating reports, you can usually customize the display order by selecting Customize Report and dragging/dropping columns into the preferred sequence.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> This applies only to the report view, not the forms themselves.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In short, QBO does not support drag-and-drop reordering of custom fields within forms or system-generated lists like purchase orders. The only workaround is to delete and recreate fields in the order you’d like as you previously suspected.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Please let me know if you’d like me to take any action in QBO on your behalf, or if it makes sense for us to schedule a quick call, as you suggested earlier, Camille.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Kind regards,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Right now, you have five custom fields in total:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> PO No.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> VENDOR CODE
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Vendor Details
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> PO Number
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Item IDs
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> They are ordered by creation date. Since QuickBooks only allows API access to the first three custom fields, we currently can’t access PO Number and Item IDs - but those are the ones we need for the auto-invoicing system to work correctly.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The solution is to reorder the fields so they look like this:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> PO Number
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Item IDs
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> PO No.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> VENDOR CODE
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Vendor Details
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> I’m not sure if QuickBooks allows this kind of reordering directly, but I’m confident their support team can help. Could you please contact QuickBooks support and request that they reorder the fields as above?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> If they can’t or won’t, then the alternative would be to delete all of the existing custom fields and recreate them in the correct order. >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Hi Camille and Katie,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> I've prepared a Loom recording of the automatic invoicing system to gather your feedback. You can view it here <https://www.loom.com/share/938098ed598f498c99e53eb8de9ed059?sid=2f2cdc01-b5bb-45ab-acf2-d3f09c8b01e4>.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Here's a quick overview:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In addition to changing a line item's status to "ready to invoice", you'll now need to specify whether you want it as a single invoice or part of a group invoice.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> For partial invoicing, I've added a new column where you can enter the quantity you wish to invoice. While I can implement logic to ignore this for non-partial invoices, I highly recommend using this column for all invoices to prevent errors.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The automation will run for a defined number of times a day, sweep all of the line items ready to be invoiced, and generate invoices based on the grouping status (single/group) and the invoice quantity. 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Once we've finalized this, I'll move on to packing slips. I have a few questions regarding them:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When would you prefer the packing slips to be auto-generated?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Does one invoice typically correspond to one shipment, and therefore one packing slip?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Your feedback on these points would be greatly appreciated.

subject: 2nd Phase Integrations: Packing Slips
2nd Phase Integrations: Packing Slips
body:
Not sure if this will help at all, but this is what the script looks like on my end. 

 function myFunction() {
  function doPost(e) {
 try {
   // Parse JSON body
   const params = e.postData.contents ? JSON.parse(e.postData.contents) : {};

   // Defaults if not provided
   const customFilename = params.filename || "packing-slip.pdf";

   // Spreadsheet & folder
   const spreadsheetId = "1IBRyMsA3y1nHBguZOrjfiJxs4CvlcX_sG-YvUFxUjQg";
   const sheetName = "Packing Slip";
   const folderId = "1asOmvSaOONyNm-wXZY5WzhlYz2bmU3TX";
   const folder = DriveApp.getFolderById(folderId);

   // Export the sheet
   const sheet = SpreadsheetApp.getActiveSpreadsheet().getSheetByName(sheetName);
   const url = "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/" + spreadsheetId +
     "/export?format=pdf&portrait=true&size=A4&sheetnames=false&printtitle=false" +
     "&pagenumbers=false&gridlines=false&fzr=false&gid=" + sheet.getSheetId();

   const token = ScriptApp.getOAuthToken();
   const response = UrlFetchApp.fetch(url, {
     headers: { Authorization: "Bearer " + token }
   });

   // Save with custom filename
   const blob = response.getBlob().setName(customFilename);
   const file = folder.createFile(blob);

   // Make it shareable
   file.setSharing(DriveApp.Access.ANYONE_WITH_LINK, DriveApp.Permission.VIEW);

   // Return JSON
   return ContentService.createTextOutput(
     JSON.stringify({
       filename: file.getName(),
       url: file.getUrl(),
       id: file.getId(),
     })
   ).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);

 } catch (err) {
   return ContentService.createTextOutput(
     JSON.stringify({ error: err.toString() })
   ).setMimeType(ContentService.MimeType.JSON);
 }
}

}
—
Katie Hilton
UP Aviation

1457 Merrimon Ave.
Asheville, NC 28804

Office: 828.774.5500
Email: katiehilton@upaviation.com 
_____________________________________________

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> ﻿
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Good evening, Camille & Sakil,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Camille – my apologies for the delay in responding; I was out of the office most of the day. Yes, I’m comfortable checking this for you or making the adjustments on your behalf.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Sakil – I reached out to QuickBooks Online (QBO) support for guidance regarding reordering the custom fields, and here’s the response I received:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Forms (Purchase Orders, Invoices, etc.):
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> QBO does not currently allow direct reordering of custom fields once they’ve been created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The fields typically display in the order they were originally created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> To change the order, you would need to delete the existing fields and recreate them in the desired sequence (e.g., create “PO Number” first, then “Item IDs,” and so on).
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Important note: deleting fields may result in the loss of any data already tied to those fields, so it’s recommended to back up or export data before making changes.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Reports:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When generating reports, you can usually customize the display order by selecting Customize Report and dragging/dropping columns into the preferred sequence.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> This applies only to the report view, not the forms themselves.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In short, QBO does not support drag-and-drop reordering of custom fields within forms or system-generated lists like purchase orders. The only workaround is to delete and recreate fields in the order you’d like as you previously suspected.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Please let me know if you’d like me to take any action in QBO on your behalf, or if it makes sense for us to schedule a quick call, as you suggested earlier, Camille.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Kind regards,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Right now, you have five custom fields in total:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> PO No.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> VENDOR CODE
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Vendor Details
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> PO Number
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Item IDs
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> They are ordered by creation date. Since QuickBooks only allows API access to the first three custom fields, we currently can’t access PO Number and Item IDs - but those are the ones we need for the auto-invoicing system to work correctly.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The solution is to reorder the fields so they look like this:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> PO Number
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Item IDs
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> PO No.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> VENDOR CODE
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Vendor Details
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> I’m not sure if QuickBooks allows this kind of reordering directly, but I’m confident their support team can help. Could you please contact QuickBooks support and request that they reorder the fields as above?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Hi Camille and Katie,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> I've prepared a Loom recording of the automatic invoicing system to gather your feedback. You can view it here <https://www.loom.com/share/938098ed598f498c99e53eb8de9ed059?sid=2f2cdc01-b5bb-45ab-acf2-d3f09c8b01e4>.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Here's a quick overview:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In addition to changing a line item's status to "ready to invoice", you'll now need to specify whether you want it as a single invoice or part of a group invoice.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> For partial invoicing, I've added a new column where you can enter the quantity you wish to invoice. While I can implement logic to ignore this for non-partial invoices, I highly recommend using this column for all invoices to prevent errors.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The automation will run for a defined number of times a day, sweep all of the line items ready to be invoiced, and generate invoices based on the grouping status (single/group) and the invoice quantity. 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Once we've finalized this, I'll move on to packing slips. I have a few questions regarding them:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When would you prefer the packing slips to be auto-generated?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Does one invoice typically correspond to one shipment, and therefore one packing slip?
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Your feedback on these points would be greatly appreciated.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>

body:

subject: update please
body:
Hi David, 

We just heard back from the supplier, it looks like the parts are at the outside processor for Black Oxide coating. They are hoping to have them back in house to complete by the end of the month, and are working on expedite options as well.

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Good evening, Camille & Sakil,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Camille – my apologies for the delay in responding; I was out of the office most of the day. Yes, I’m comfortable checking this for you or making the adjustments on your behalf.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Sakil – I reached out to QuickBooks Online (QBO) support for guidance regarding reordering the custom fields, and here’s the response I received:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Forms (Purchase Orders, Invoices, etc.):
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> QBO does not currently allow direct reordering of custom fields once they’ve been created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> The fields typically display in the order they were originally created.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> To change the order, you would need to delete the existing fields and recreate them in the desired sequence (e.g., create “PO Number” first, then “Item IDs,” and so on).
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Important note: deleting fields may result in the loss of any data already tied to those fields, so it’s recommended to back up or export data before making changes.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Custom Fields on Reports:
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> When generating reports, you can usually customize the display order by selecting Customize Report and dragging/dropping columns into the preferred sequence.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> This applies only to the report view, not the forms themselves.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> In short, QBO does not support drag-and-drop reordering of custom fields within forms or system-generated lists like purchase orders. The only workaround is to delete and recreate fields in the order you’d like as you previously suspected.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Please let me know if you’d like me to take any action in QBO on your behalf, or if it makes sense for us to schedule a quick call, as you suggested earlier, Camille.
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> Kind regards,
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> 
>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
